Package org.jamwiki.servlets

Provides classes that work with the Spring Framework to process HTTP requests and to then redirect appropriately.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AdminServlet
    Used to provide administrative functions including changing Wiki configuration settings and refreshing internal Wiki objects.
    AdminVirtualWikiServlet  
    BlockListServlet
    Display a list of currently blocked usernames and IP addresses.
    BlockServlet
    Used to provide capability for blocking a user by login or IP address.
    CategoryServlet
    Used for display a list of all categories that are currently in use for a virtual wiki.
    ContributionsServlet
    Used to generate a list of all edits made by a user.
    DiffServlet
    Used to display a diff between two versions of a topic.
    EditServlet
    Used to process topic edits including saving an edit, preview, resolving conflicts and dealing with spam.
    ExportServlet
    Used to export an XML file from a wiki topic.
    HistoryServlet
    Used to display the edit history information for a topic.
    ImageServlet
    Get image requests handler.
    ImportServlet
    Used to import an XML file creating a topic as a result.
    ItemsServlet
    Used to build Special: pages that display lists of topics on the Wiki, such as when displaying lists of all existing images or topics.
    JAMWikiFilter
    Perform filtering of all Wiki page requests, including setting the character encoding to UTF-8 and verifying that no setup or upgrade is required.
    JAMWikiListener
    A ServletContextListener that will do necessary initialization and cleanup when the Servlet Context is initialized and destroyed.
    JAMWikiLocaleInterceptor
    This method extends the Spring LocaleChangeInterceptor to search for and use a locale key in either the session or the request if one can be found.
    JAMWikiServlet
    Provides the infrastructure that is common to all JAMWiki servlets.
    LinkToServlet
    Used to render a list of all topics that link to another topic.
    LoginServlet
    Used to handle requests or redirects to the login page, as well as requests to logout.
    LogServlet
    Used to build the Special:Log page for displaying log information.
    ManageServlet
    Used to provide capability for deleting, undeleting, and protecting topics.
    MoveServlet
    Used to handle moving a topic to a new name.
    PasswordResetServlet
    Used to handle requests or redirects to the login page, as well as requests to logout.
    PrintableServlet
    Used to display a print-friendly version of a topic.
    RecentChangesFeedServlet
    Provides an RSS or Atom feed for recent changes.
    RecentChangesServlet
    Used to display a summary of edits made, ordered chronologically.
    RegisterServlet
    Used to process new user account setup.
    RolesServlet  
    SearchServlet
    Used to display search results.
    ServletUtil
    Utility methods useful when processing JAMWiki servlet requests.
    SetupServlet
    Used to handle JAMWiki setup, including setting and validating JAMWiki configuration values.
    SpecialPagesServlet
    Used to generate an index of all Special: pages on the wiki.
    StylesheetServlet
    Used to generate the jamwiki.css stylesheet.
    TopicServlet
    Used to display a JAMWiki topic.
    TranslationServlet
    Used to provide admins with the ability to create and edit JAMWiki message keys.
    UpgradeServlet
    Used to automatically handle JAMWiki upgrades, including configuration and data modifications.
    UploadServlet
    Used to handle file uploads.
    ViewSourceServlet
    Used to allow a user to view a topic source.
    WatchlistServlet
    Used to handle updating and viewing a user's watchlist.
    WikiPageInfo
    The WikiPageInfo class provides an object containing common data used for generating wiki page display.

Package org.jamwiki.servlets Description

Provides classes that work with the Spring Framework to process HTTP requests and to then redirect appropriately. To create a new Wiki page the following steps should be followed:
  • Modify the /WEB-INF/jamwiki-servlet.xml file to add a mapping and a servlet handler.
    • The mapping is the URL pattern. For example <prop key="/**/Special:MyPage">MyHandler</prop>.
    • The handler links the mapping with a servlet. For example: <bean id="MyHandler" class="org.jamwiki.servlets.MyServlet" />.
  • Make sure JAMWiki recognizes the page as an existing special page by adding a pseudotopic entry to org.jamwiki.utils.PseudoTopicHandler.
  • Create the servlet specified in the jamwiki-servlet.xml file (org.jamwiki.servlets.MyServlet). The servlet should extend JAMWikiServlet.
  • Create a JSP for the page display. Within your servlet the WikiPageInfo.setContentJsp(java.lang.String) method should be called to link the new JSP page with your servlet.
